Docs.summary: Represents the SOAP style that determines how the WSDL metadata for the service is formatted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the message body is formatted with the Style set to Document. The style `RPC` means that the WSDL representation of messages exchanged for an operation contains parameters as if it were a remote procedure call. The following is an example.
``` <wsdl:message name="IUseAndStyleCalculator_Add_InputMessage"> <wsdl:part name="n1" type="xsd:double"/> <wsdl:part name="n2" type="xsd:double"/> </wsdl:message>
```
Setting the style to `Document` means that the WSDL representation contains a single element that represents the document that is exchanged for an operation as shown in the following example.
``` <wsdl:message name="IUseAndStyleCalculator_Add_InputMessage"> <wsdl:part name="parameters" element="tns:Add"/> </wsdl:message> ```
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute?displayProperty=fullName> to set this value.
